title: Martinelli’s two yellow cards in five seconds!
shortDescription: Gabriel Martinelli was sent off in bizarre circumstances after the Arsenal forward received two yellow cards in five seconds for two separate incidents, resulting in a red card during Arsenal’s 1-0 win against Wolves.

title: Papers: Chelsea braced for Kepa interest
shortDescription: All the top stories and transfer rumours from Friday's national newspapers...

title: Klopp: Liverpool don't have City on their toes yet | Diaz, Jota praised
shortDescription: Jurgen Klopp claimed Liverpool "do not have Man City on their toes yet" in the title race as he praised the contributions of Luis Diaz and Diogo Jota against Leicester.

title: Arteta 'out of ideas' as Arsenal receive fourth red of 2022
shortDescription: Mikel Arteta admits he is "out of ideas" about how to stop his Arsenal players from being sent off after Gabriel Martinelli saw red at Wolves.

title: Premier League top-four race: Fourth place up for grabs?
shortDescription: We assess the runners and riders in the race for the top four, their form and their fixtures until the end of the season...

title: Salah returns as Jota fires Liverpool to win
shortDescription: FREE TO WATCH: Highlights of Liverpool's win against Leicester City in the Premier League.

title: Arsenal go fifth with 1-0 win at Wolves
shortDescription: FREE TO WATCH: Highlights of Arsenal's win against Wolves in the Premier League.

title: Jota double as Liverpool see off Leicester
shortDescription: Liverpool kept their slim title hopes alive as Diogo Jota's double secured a 2-0 win over Leicester at Anfield.

title: Neil set to take over at Sunderland after agreement reached
shortDescription: An agreement is in place for Alex Neil to become the new Sunderland manager.

title: Chelsea vs Arsenal: Is this the WSL title decider?
shortDescription: As Chelsea and Arsenal meet in a huge WSL showdown on Friday, Sky Sports' journalists, reporters and pundits give their views on the potential title decider.

title: Solhekol secures chief reporter role at Sky Sports News
shortDescription: Kaveh Solhekol has been appointed as the new Chief Reporter at Sky Sports News.

title: Raith boss: Goodwillie signing 'enormous mistake'
shortDescription: Raith Rovers manager John McGlynn has admitted the club made an "enormous mistake" in thinking only about football when signing David Goodwillie.

title: Man City striker Kelly signs new three-year deal
shortDescription: Manchester City striker Chloe Kelly has signed a new three-year deal that will keep her at the club until 2025.

title: Premier League begins removing emergency Covid rules
shortDescription: The Premier League has announced a number of its Covid-19 emergency measures will be removed from Friday, with the aim of more ending by the end of the month.

title: Prutton's Championship predictions
shortDescription: Who is David Prutton tipping for victory in the Sky Bet Championship this weekend? Find out here...

title: Man Utd pair Galton and Skinner win monthly WSL awards
shortDescription: Man Utd forward Leah Galton has won the Women's Super League Player of the Month award for January, while her boss Marc Skinner has won Manager of the Month.

title: Rice: Racist abuse after Euro 2020 final was terrible
shortDescription: In an interview with Gary Neville's The Overlap Youtube channel, Declan Rice said racist abuse aimed at England players following the Euro 2020 final was "terrible".

title: Papers: Liverpool want Argentine wonderkid Farias
shortDescription: All the top stories and transfer rumours from Thursday's national newspapers...

title: Antonio questions Zouma reaction: 'Is what he's done worse than racism?'
shortDescription: West Ham's Michail Antonio has questioned the reaction to the Kurt Zouma cat-kicking incident, saying: "Is it worse than players convicted of racism?".

title: Spurs on Y-word: 'It's time to move on'
shortDescription: Tottenham have released a statement on their fans' use of the Y-word, saying that "it is time to move on" from associating the term with the club.
